block.p: Global warming will have highly uneven consequences in rich and poor regions of the world, experts say. Illinois, left, and Malawi, right, both face intensifying droughts. But American farmers have sophisticated devices to predict atmospheric changes; in Malawi, one of the world's poorest countries, weather stations are scattered and technology is out of date or not functioning. Reports from four fronts in the war on warming.
SCIENCE TIMES, PAGES F4 AND F5
